column4: hi 1 question please, why stopping a job, then type jobs -l to get the pid, i do kill (pid) and doesn't work? even with sudo, i need to kill it with -9
-9 means SIGKILL. I don't think it is has something to do what the system considers to be important
and kill needs you to specify a signal. kill pid won't work. maybe use  kill -15 pid.
